page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Through the middle of our area passes the A23 London to Brighton Trunk Road and to the South is a view of the South Downs. The country roads are winding and narrow and there are clusters of trees mostly deciduous.The fields are surrounded by hedgerows,and are used for cereal crops, pasture, winter feed and market gardening, including soft fruits. Ditches along the hedges drain the clay soil into the River Adur. There are some small ponds which are used by licenced anglers. There is one village which is Sayers Common, and two hamlets, Twineham and High Cross. To the far South East of the area is a small section of the larger village of Hurspierpoint. To the South of Sayers Common the A23 changes into dual carriageway and is sheduled to be reconstructed soon.
